author: Reuters Editorial
title: White House adviser expects to bring proposal to trade talks
text:
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - White House chief economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Thursday that he expects China to bring a proposal to trade talks in Washington this week, and said that would “extend the conversation and permit additional negotiations.”
FILE PHOTO: U.S. President Donald Trump's top economic adviser Larry Kudlow is interviewed at the White House in Washington. U.S., April 6, 2018. REUTERS/Kevin Lamarque “We’ll be glad to have this discussion,” Kudlow told Fox Business Network. “It’s absolutely essential to the president’s trade and economic policy.”
Reporting by Justin Mitchell; Editing by Tim Ahmann
